intro: Lampranthus marcidulus, commonly known as the dwarf ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers that often resemble small stars. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
